header: Christian is going to San Salvador to continue his engagement

Author's words: Mr Jakins watched into Christian's room and saw that Christian had waken up. At this moment Christian was staying near his bed and put bedclothes off from the bed. Mr Jakins began speaking with his grandchild.

Christian's grandpa: Good morning, Christian. How was your sleeping?

Christian: My sleeping was fine, grandpa. Thanks.

Christian's grandpa: It is great. I am very glad. I have a few questions about your trip. As I understand you are going to go to carry out your contemplation regarding extra-decomposers. Am I right?

Christian: I can't say "carry out". I don't know how long my contemplation in this scientific area will be continuing. I can say that I am going to continue my contemplation. But I don't presume it will be finised soon.

Christian's grandpa: All right. I wish you to be lucky and I have a few questions else to you.

Christian: I am listening you.

Christian's grandpa: The first question is how long will your absence be lasting?

Christian: I can't say exactly. Sorry. It is not known yet.

Christian's grandpa: The second question is where are you going? I mean what country, what city.

Christian: I am going to San Salvador. It is a great place on the brink of the Pacific ocean. There is a fertility of different interesting extra-decomposers. Did I not told you and grandma about it?

Christian's grandpa: Maybe you did, but I am sorry, I forgot. How do you know that there is a fertility of different extra-decomposers in San Salvador?

Christian: Beatrix told me about it. Now she lives in Pacific ocean with Woman-devil and different other interesting creatures near this place.

Author's words: Christian and Mr Jakins heard voice of Mrs Jakins from outside of this room:

Christian's grandma: The breakfast is ready, boys. I am inviting you to the table.

Christian: (Turning to the exit of the room) Ok, grandma. We are going.

Christian's grandpa: Woman-devil?

Christian: Yes. This is such specific woman. She is a devil and in the same time she is somebody like a human. It turned out that she had created all these extra-decomposers to upheld ballance in nature.

Christian's grandpa: I have never heard about her earlier! How do you know about her?

Christian: Judy and Beatrix told me about her. Moreover, they met her personally. They like her. Beatrix posited that Woman-devil is quite good person.

Christian's grandpa: It is curious and very, very intresting.

Christian: It may be intresting for you, but it is not diserable to tell my grandma about it.

Author's words: Christian and his grandpa has arrived to the kitchen and taken seats at the table.

Christian's grandpa: Can you tell me about your upcoming engagement in San Salvador more?

Christian: Of course, why not? But not right now. I know, grandma does not like when we talk more in eating time.

Christian's grandma: Yes, my dear, and it is good, that you don't forget about it. But it is not enough for my calmness.

Christian: Grandma, there is nothing about to worry very much. By the way, I like this salad of stew cabbage and marrow squash very much! Thank you, grandma, for caring for us! Thank you very much!

Christian's grandma: I never spare to spend time and energy for you, my dear boys!

Christian's grandpa: Yes, Annette. You are nice! I love you!

Author's words: After these people had finished their breakfast, mrs Jakins gave the dishes and put it in the sell.

Christian's grandpa: I hope we may continue our conversation a little before I will go to the job. I can't endure to listen about your engagement more! I have some time to communicate with you about it before I will be prompted to go to my job! I remember you have told much me and your grandma, but would like to listen about extra-decomposers something new!

Christian: Grandpa, there will be more news after I will have learned a lot about extra-decomposers in San Salvador.

Christian's grandpa: But I am interested if you can tell something new right now a little at least. I am very glad that you work in this scientific area.

Christian's grandma: I feel commotion in my mind regarding to this conversation.

Christian's grandpa: What is wrong with you?

Christian: I want to learn them particularly and to be a large connoiseur in this scientific area.

Christian's grandma: What is your inducement to do this? May I be interested in this question?

Christian: It was very appealing theme for me in my previous life. As I have already told you and grandpa, I was not lucky to complete some inquiries. And I profess to do that in this my life.

Christian's grandma: Yes, I remember how much you told us. I was daunted. It is not so airily as you, may be, think, Christian. I have already understood that you purport something what you purported in your previous life, but I can't understand something other.

Christian: What exactly?

Christian's grandma: I worry about you. I do it after you told us your storie about your scientific life. I am asked by myself such question: what if it is your redundant interference in nature? I listened not very pleasant things from you. I remember you told about this strange picture with naked woman who had so stunning body! You told that you had seen it in your previous lamentable life. You were overhelmed that it was naked and so strange with tail like a lion tail and a big eye on the ass. You were tumulted in this time very much. I was commoted to know about this and about those case with a strange fear beast when you scarcely did not go mad. I think If I had been you this event would have been very instructive case for me. Besides this, seems to me, these extra-decomposers are not so frivolous. You said there are some different and poisonous insects among them. Don't you see something menacing in this?

Christian: Grandma, it is not just my whim. It is my job and very serious job. Not only I engage it. There are many other scientists who also do it. We communicate between each-other regarding different questions about extra-decomposers. We have found out that the extradecomposers are not so dangerous as you presume.

Christian's grandma: Your serious job? As I know you do remember sequel of the same serious job in your previous life and I want you to retreat anything what maybe perilous for your life or health.

Christian: Grandma, I have responsibility for myself, trust me. Now I have a hypothesis who this might be, that naked woman. I presume this is the same woman with whom my acquaintances communicated friendly. They like her.

Christian's grandma: But this your appalling engagement is not your liability in front of god. It is dubious in my vantage point that it is very needful deal. It is a serious life jeopardy. Tell me, please, frankly. Do you really sensate insurmountable demand to mess about these strange nature secrets?

Christian: I stoutly decided to engage science what I engaged in my previous life. I was born with this purpose.What are you conjuring me to do? Do you want to say that I must abdicate from my job?

Christian's grandma: Seems to me now we are talking not about the same things and you are behavioring like a stubborn mutt.Moreover what seems to me - it is that you underestimate what hazard is your life in. You are under influence of your whimsy and insurmountable heat to explore these strange live specie. It is very lamentable, Christian. I afraid that you will understand and see the situation through my eyes only when you will have been gotten in a very hard and upleasant situation where you will pity about it.

Christian: No, there is nothing like that in this situation! I swear that I am not indifferent to your harassment in your mood, I don't like your anxiety. But my opinion is that your opinion which you have just said is fallacy. You would understand the situation much more better if you were a scientist like me and worked in this scientific area. I can tell you very much about extra-decomposers. So you can know about what now you can't even guess.

Christian's grandpa: Listen to me, please. Listen what I want to say. It is great that you work in this scientific area, but from other side it is not so good as you think. I find it a real peril. How do you know who are these extra-decomposers? Maybe they are really poisonous and perilous beings. I remember I heard that Beatrix is poisonous. What may be about different other extra-decomposers?

Christian: Please, Grandpa and, especially, Grandma, don't be so flagrant and listen to me. It has been already proved that extra-decomposers are not so perilous as you presume. I communicated with other scientists who notably learn extra-decomposers and they told me much about this specie. I can tell you particularly if you want.

Christian's grandma: I can't find forces for mortification in myself and I still can't understand your mettle to learn this things.

Christian: You had never been fonded by this scientific area. You and me are completely different persons with different ideology. So you and grandpa will never understand my incentive to engage in this scientific area. Besides this I have noticed that you are continuing your agitation when you have not listened yet what I can tell about extra-decomposers.

Christian's grandpa: And what assertion exists which tells that extra-decomposers are not significant hazard to explore them?

Christian: I have been already learning extra-decomposers for a long time. Besides I learned them independently I talked with many other scientists who also learn them and know about them very much. Nobody of the scientist with whom I communicated have not died yet. The scientists have approval that extra-decomposers are enough clever and don't harm innocent people.

Christian's grandma: So you think flatly there is absolutely nothing dangerous for you and your safety is notfickle?

Christian: Yes, I think so.

Christian's grandma: Don't you presume that there may be some scientists who suffered from the extra-decomposers in their exploration?

Christian: I did not hear about tragic cases.  I think it scarce could be.

Christian's grandpa: But it is not testimony that you are in absolute safety.

Christian: Extra-decomposers are not whom are usual dangerous and poisonous animals and insects on our planet. Many of scientists told me about their inquiries. They told about behaviour of extra-decomposers. These beings were very tranquil whatever the scientists did with them. These people did not try to torment these beings despite they put them in cages to learn their organism. Scientist do it through special apparatuses and don't experiment these beings in such way where there is a jeopardy for life or health of these beings. I remember Beatrix warned that it is better for scientist not to do this with extra-decomposers, otherwise woman-devil can feel it and do something very unpleasant. So, we don't experience extra-decomposers in dangerous for their life way.
Have I propitiated your feelings?

Christian's grandma: Who!? Woman-devil!!!!!????

Christian: I knew that I should not to mention this daunting word in our conversation at all!

Christian's grandma: Seems to me, your demand to tinker with this phenomenais just insatiable.

Christian: Have I not told enough yet? What makes this disturbance in you?

Christian's grandpa: I just remember that the extra-decomposer named Beatrix was poisonous.

Christian: Yes, she is, but I told you about her and different extra-decomposers. They are not whom ruthless unconscious murderers are! Poison is given to extra-decomposers to protect themselves from predators who may be dangerous for their life. But it is not for poisoning people even scientist who may not to give them calm life.

Christian's grandpa: OK. We presume, you are absolutely right about your safety if we talk about extra-decomposers. But I am not calm regarding another question. I know you remember your past life well. I remember what you told me and your grandma. You told about this shocking creature whom you saw in your previous life. According to your words It was similar to a naked woman, but had what people don't have. I remember your narrative about this terrifying body: this eye on the one of halfs of the ass, this tail with brush on its end, horns, big clutches. I remember you told about this fascinating event! You went in a forest and suddenly stumbled upon so strange picture - a creature like a human, but naked with all these wonders! I remember you told with expressive intonation how overhelming it was. Besides this I remember you told about a scary creature which you had seen in a forest. It was somebody like a big wild predatory beast and you run away spending all your forces. It was very breathtakingly, and it was why you could not to continue science after that. You recognized that it, thank god, had not pursued you, but some time later.

Christian: Now I guess who was the creature similar a naked woman. If I am right it means that this woman is not so horrific as you think. Moreover my acquaintances know her. Beatrix lives with her in the ocean. Judy met and communicated with her. This woman was pleased after the meeting.

Christian's grandma: Really?

Christian: Yes, grandma. I don't think that your resentment about this woman is apposite at this moment.

Christian's grandpa: Who was pleased: Judy or this strange creature?

Christian: Both of them. According to Beatrix's words this seemingly strange woman is who created all these extra-decomposers and she has created them with such purpose as to refine nature from different redundant yuck.

Christian's grandma: But if something trouble happens with you, I guess, Beatrix will not be responsible for this. So we can to make her to report how it could be that she had assured you in safety of your job, but eventually there occured something unpleasant and unexpectable with you.

Christian's grandpa: You did not met this woman and talk with her, did you?

Christian: I did not. I abdicated Beatrix's suggestion to go with her, meet this woman and talk with her. I decided, that I don't need this as a scientist.

Christian's grandma: It is thank God. But how do you know that she is the same woman by whom you were overhelmed in your previous life?

Christian: I know this as a scientist. Many of scientists know meaning of existance of extra-decomposers. Scientists who learn them communicate to each-other, share knowledges between each-other. Beatrix told about this woman who has created extra-decomposers.  Judy met with her and told about her. This woman created extra-decomposers through her magic forces.

Christian's grandma: Really!?

Christian: Calm down, grandma, please. It is not related to you if you are scared.

Christian's grandma: I worry about where are you climbing, Christian. You are not a stranger for me.

Christian: I just said about this strange woman about whom you and grandpa worry. But I will not interfere in her life. It is just what I am not interested. But I have to know something what I have not known yet. It is related with features and life style of the extra-decomposers. So I am going to the place where I can do it.

Christian's grandpa: My dear grandson and yong scientist, I am curious about something. You said there must be no extra-decomposers soon. What will you do then?

Christian: I don't know. This question demands to think about it.

Christian's grandma: To be honest, I can say this thought only amplifies my dissarayhowever strange you can find it. Christian, I want to beleive that job of a scientist is a tangible threat not in any area! By the way, Andy and you, Christian, too, have you ever had such thought in your mind: what if Christian, don't admit, god, is not satisfied by his attainments in this life like he was not in his previous life? So, will Christian have the idea to correct this like he has decided being born in this life? I mean, of course, will he have another one or maybe more attempts to be born in next life to do the trick in next life?

Christian's grandpa: Please, let me think during a few minutes after what I will have to say and go to the job not slowly. I must deliberate your question piled with the declarative sentences. Well, the implications is that you are concerned if I had hypothesis regarding the question: if Christian's badluck repeats again in this life will Christian have a possibility to rehabilitate with this being born again in the next life?

Christian's grandma: Yes. You understand right. It is glorious that you are understanding man.

Christian's grandpa: Well, I did not have thoughts like this one. I hoped that Christian will be lucky in this life. Also I beleived that he is very clever and intelligent and capable to cope with all the tasks arishing in his serious and interesting job. Even when he told me and you about his engagement I did not have a thought that it may be dangerous. But I had one negative though when Christian had told us about this strange naked creature which was so dizzying. I was surprised very negatively. I could not understand how it maybe possible. But I completely did not presume that Christian can collide with something very unpleasant and dizzying in his current life. Maybe if I was on the Christian's place I could not make an attempt to rehibilitate like Christian because I have not so strong nerves as Christian has. But now I have concluded that Christian is very strong and self-confident. I have concluded it of the fact that his job seems to me is not the most tranquil one. Well, I have to go to my job. I wish Christian goodluck in his job in San Salvador. I would like you, Christian, to call me often when you will have left us.

Christian's grandpa: Bye, Christian and Annette.

Christian's grandma: Bye, Andy.

Author's words: Christian's grandpa is rising and lefting the house.

Christian: I am going to prepare to my trip. I have to deliberate many things about it - anything, what I must take with myself and, what is not less important - how I will explore extra-decomposers and what I have to know about them of I have not known yet.

Christian's grandma: Go, Christian. I hope you will not have to do something very unpleasant with them what Woman-devil would not approve. I wish you and her never to see each-other.

Author's words: Christian felt that despite his interest to his job his mood had been spoiled a little by commotion of his not very intelligent grandma whose world-vision is completely not similar to Christian's world-vision.
